greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Array read by antidiagonals: T(m,n) is the number of fixed polyominoes that have a width of m and height of n.
comment: Equivalently, the number of m X n binary arrays with all 1's connected and at least one 1 on each edge.
Also, the number of m X n binary arrays with a path of adjacent 1's and no path of adjacent 0's from top row to bottom row.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..435
Andrew Howroyd, Fixed polyominoes by width, height and number of cells
Index entries for sequences related to polyominoes
formula: T(m, n) = U(m, n) - 2*U(m, n-1) + U(m, n-2) where U(m, n) = V(m, n) - 2*V(m-1, n) + V(m-2, n) and V(m, n) = A287151(m, n).
example: T(2,2) = 5 counts 4 3-ominoes of shape 2x2 and 1 4-omino of shape 2x2.
T(3,2) = 15 counts 8 4-ominoes of shape 3x2, 6 5-ominoes of shape 3x2, and 1 6-omino of shape 3x2.
T(4,2) = 39 counts 12 5-ominoes of shape 4x2, 18 6-ominoes of shape 4x2, 8 7-ominoes of shape 4x2, and 1 8-omino of shape 4x2.
mathematica: Clear[V]; VV = Table[V[m-n+1, n], {m, 1, mmax}, {n, 1, m}] // Flatten;
Table[T[m-n+1, n], {m, 1, mmax}, {n, 1, m}] // Flatten // Take[#, imax]& (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Sep 22 2019 *)
results.author: _Andrew Howroyd_, Oct 02 2017
